comment.author: 68061336@N05
comment._content: Commonwealth War Graves Commission lists the following details Name: HERBISON Initials: E N Nationality: South African Rank: Private Regiment/Service: South African Infantry Unit Text: 4th Regt. Date of Death: 19/09/1916 Service No: 3799 Casualty Type: Commonwealth War Dead Grave/Memorial Reference: III. A. 15. Cemetery: VILLERS STATION CEMETERY, VILLERS-AU-BOIS Interstingly no parents or next of kin details ? Photo of Grave Marker can be seen here twgpp.org/information.php?id=2179234

comment.author: 75390954@N08
comment._content:
I found this in the Blackmoor Marriages record for St. Mathews Church.

6 November 1915. Page 108 no. 216

Ernest Newman HERBISON 27 bachelor, Pte. South African Scottish of Bordon Camp and Ella….. SUMMERS 27 spinster of Wittcomb Terrace, Whitehill, were married by licence; groom’s father James HERBISON, surveyor; bride’s father, Thomas SUMMERS; witnesses, Alice E. EYRES, Gilbert Weston BONE.

comment.author: 75390954@N08
comment._content: Also found a listing in the Journal of the Institute of Bankers Vol. 31, p.406, from 1910. The Preliminary Examinations list shows Ernest Newman Herbison, Bury St. Edmunds under the National Provincial Bank of England, Ltd.
